bibl.title: Four North-Nubian Funerary Stelae from the Bankes Collection.
Nubian Voices II. New Texts and Studies on Christian Nubian Culture

bibl.note: 1. National Trust inv. no. 1257703. Funerary stela of a woman Protokia [in Greek]. Probably Tafa (Taphis), ca. 7th century. - 2. Inv. no. 1257704. Funerary stela of a woman Edra [in Greek]. Probably Kalabsha (Talmis), ca. 7th century. - 3. Inv. no. 1257706. Funerary stela of a priest Severus [in Greek]. Region of Tafa (Taphis) - Kalabsha (Talmis), ca. 7th-9th century? - 3. Inv. no. 1257705. Funerary stela of a deacon Kolothos [in Coptic]. Kalabsha (Talmis) or its vicinity, ca. 9th century.
bibl.seg: Jacques van der Vliet & Klaas A. Worp, Four North-Nubian Funerary Stelae from the Bankes Collection.

Adam Łajtar, Grzegorz Ochała & Jacques van der Vliet (edd.), Nubian Voices II. New Texts and Studies on Christian Nubian Culture = The Journal of Juristic Papyrology. Supplements. Volume XXVII (Warsaw, 2015) pp. 27-43.

1. National Trust inv. no. 1257703. Funerary stela of a woman Protokia [in Greek]. Probably Tafa (Taphis), ca. 7th century. - 2. Inv. no. 1257704. Funerary stela of a woman Edra [in Greek]. Probably Kalabsha (Talmis), ca. 7th century. - 3. Inv. no. 1257706. Funerary stela of a priest Severus [in Greek]. Region of Tafa (Taphis) - Kalabsha (Talmis), ca. 7th-9th century? - 3. Inv. no. 1257705. Funerary stela of a deacon Kolothos [in Coptic]. Kalabsha (Talmis) or its vicinity, ca. 9th century.
